title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-10.2 - Right to aid continuing

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-10.2 - Right to aid continuing

State Regulations

In certain circumstances, the SSP or SSPNA recipient
has the right to have SSP benefits or SSPNA continued unchanged until the fair
hearing decision is issued. The Office of Administrative Hearings (OAH) will
determine whether the recipient is entitled to aid continuing and will advise
the Office and the recipient of its decision. (a) Where this Office is required to give
timely and adequate notice before it can take an action in the case, a
recipient will have the right to aid continuing for SSP benefits or SSPNA until
the fair hearing decision is issued if the recipient requests a fair hearing
before the effective date of the proposed action as contained in the notice of
action. (b) Where this Office is
required to give adequate, but not timely notice and has discontinued, reduced, restricted or suspended SSP benefits or SSPNA, the recipient has the right to
have SSP benefits or SSPNA reinstated and continued until a fair hearing
decision is issued only if the recipient requests a fair hearing within 10 days
of the date of the notice of action issued by the Office and if OAH determines
that the action upon the SSP benefit or SSPNA did not result from the
application of, or change in, State or federal law or policy. Notes
